Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2008 05:45PM ChristianneQ wrote: Hi.   I have had my mammo and US and they are showing gigantic sized cysts.  Some need further MRI evaluation which is scheduled for tomorrow.  I had a lumpectomy in 2001, so I am very, very frightened at this time.   I don't think people understand how this feels, and I found this forum.  I am hoping to get at least something tomorrow because I need relief so bad so I can find some peace.  My Nana died of lung cancer last year and it was the worst, worst, worst thing I have ever seen.  On top of that my job is giving my some crap (I cannot believe it either).  So it is no wonder I am losing it.   I just hope after tomorrow, I can move on with my life at least get the waiting game over with.   Thanks for listening.
Posts.Title: How soon should I get MRI results? goldendragonlady lovinmomma

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2008 06:04PM Christianne wrote: A month ago, I too was scheduled for an MRI with my tissue expander in place (to check for a rotator cuff tear).  My new latest problem.  An hour before the MRI, it occured to me about the metal on the expander.  I called the MRI facility and asked about it, and they said absolutely no MRI for me until the expander comes out.  So my doctor dropped the ball too.  (this was my regular doctor who knows all about my mastectomy and expander, not the BS or PS).  In your case I think many people dropped the ball--it could have been caught on the paperwork you had to fill out before they take you back to the MRI room.  I'm sorry you had this happen.  I do hope all is well.
Posts.Title: Shouldn't of had MRI w/ EXPANDER! LUVmy2girlZ Looneymom
Shouldn't of had MRI w/ EXPANDER! LUVmy2girlZ Looneymom

Posts.Content: Christianne wrote: I am just wondering--after a mastectomy, how soon might a recurrence show up?  Would it be possible to have a recurrence in months?  Or would it take years? Dx 4/7/2008, IDC, <1cm, Stage IA, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
